inv.description: You look at the items you have gathered from the room. Currently you have:

room.description: You are in a small 4-walled room. The walls and floor are bare, cut stone. Within the room you see:

bookcase.description: A large oak bookcase appears to be fastened to the wall. It is mostly barren apart from the following items:

table.description: A sturdy mahogany table is placed in the corner. Inspecting it you see the following items:

onuse.description: You find the painting lifts away from the wall. You place it on the floor. Behind it are 3 keyholes.

painting.description: An old faded oil painting shows an artistic image of the cathedral above, in its former glory.

onuse.description: You find the plant and the soil lift away together in one clump. You put them to one side.

bush.description: A bushy plant sits in the corner. While it appears to be long dead, it is still thick with browned foliage.

door.description: A heavy door is set tightly into the wall. The hinges appear to be on the other side. You see the following features on the door:

onuse.description: With some effort you are able to roll the rug up revealing a cold stone floor beneath. You replace the rug.

rug.description: A heavy, vibrant rug lies on the floor in shades of 4 familiar colours.

onuse.description: Pulling the chest away from the wall reveals a cold stone wall and floor. However, you notice a drawer on the bottom that opens backwards. You pull this out.

chest.description: A large chest lies on the floor with thick metallic clasps binding it shut. Each of the 2 clasps has a lock that you can see:

pot.description: A musty teracotta pot remains where the bushy plant once stood. Within it you can see:

onuse.description: This is only half a key, with a groove to attach another half. You'll need to combine the two for it to be useful.

brass-key-one.description: This is a dirty piece of brass. It appears to be half of a key, with a groove on the back where another half might attach.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

red-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded red cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

cyan-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded cyan cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

purple-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded purple cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

violet-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded violet cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

dull-book.description: An old musty tome in a faded buff cover. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe some faded but legible script in Common. It appears to be about star constellations.

heavy-book.description: A thick tome containing a great many pages. It appears to have once had a title, but it's long since worn away.

onuse.description: Taking the picture from the frame, you find nothing of interest, and replace the picture.

picture-frame.description: A wooden frame containing a simple picture. It appears to be of the faceless statue you saw before approaching the coloured orbs.

onuse.description: Opening the book you observe a series of dairy entries. But the count of the years makes no sense to you.

black-book.description: A small black leather book, held closed by a string loop. It looks clean and fresh, but has no markings on the outside.

onuse.description: You slide the drawer out from the table. It is empty.

drawer-one.description: A smaller wooden draw with a handle designed to be used to pull it from the table.

onuse.description: The drawer won't budge. It appears to be locked.

drawer-two.description: A wide wooden draw with a more elaborate handle and a small keyhole beneath.

onuse.description: You slide the drawer out from the table. It is empty.

drawer-three.description: A smaller wooden draw with a chipped handle designed to be used to pull it from the table.

keyholes.description: A series of keyholes are set into the wall. Each has a coloured enamel setting. These are as follows:

onuse.description: The handle turns easily, but the door won't budge. It appears to be locked.

handle.description: A round brass knob is attached to the door.

onuse.description: You can only see blackness through the keyhole.

keyhole.description: A simple, but long keyhole sits in the thick wood of the door.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.

bronze-lock.description: A dull and plain brass lock, that is impressively sturdy.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.
You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

secret-drawer.description: A simple drawer in the same wood as the chest. Disappointingly it is empty.

onuse.description: You need to combine a key with the keyhole to use it.

violet-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a violet enamel panel.

onuse.description: You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

cyan-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a cyan enamel panel.

onuse.description: You don't know what else to do with the drawer.

red-keyhole.description: A keyhole surrounded by a red enamel panel.
